com.example.chaosruler.msa_manager.services

Class remote_SQL_Helper

  • com.example.chaosruler.msa_manager.services.remote_SQL_Helper

  • public class remote_SQL_Helper

    a singleton object that connects us to the database and sends queries to it responsible for all the remote commands

    • Field Summary

      static remote_SQL_Helper INSTANCE
      a singleton object that connects us to the database and sends queries to it responsible for all the remote commands

      • Connect

        public boolean Connect(android.content.Context con,
                       java.lang.String user,
                       java.lang.String pass,
                       LoginActivity act)

        subroutine neccesery to connect to db, without this call, no DB operations can be done

        Parameters:
        act - the activity that called this, must be refreshed constantly
        con - the context that called this, must be refreshed constantly
        user - the username that needs to connect to database
        pass - the password of that username
        Returns:
        if connection was successfull

      • get_all_table

        public java.util.Vector<java.util.HashMap> get_all_table(java.lang.String db,
                                                         java.lang.String table)

        subroutine that gets as parameters an entire table and converts it into Hashmap vector, which is later can be converted to string, sql is select * form table obviously threadded but until vector results is recieved, thread is blocked

        Parameters:
        db - the database name that we are working with
        table - the table name that we are working with
        Returns:
        a vector of the items inside this table, each element represent a row, hashmap represent cols

      • get_latest_sync_time

        public java.util.Date get_latest_sync_time()

        gets the latest sync time of the current user

        Returns:
        latest sync time of user

      • select_columns_from_db_with_where

        public java.util.Vector<java.util.HashMap> select_columns_from_db_with_where(java.lang.String db,
                                                                             java.lang.String table,
                                                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> colm_to_type,
                                                                             java.lang.String where_column,
                                                                             java.lang.String where_compare)

        simulates select * from db where ...

        Parameters:
        colm_to_type - what type are the colms
        db - the database name
        table - the table name
        where_column - where clause
        where_compare - where clause data (compare to)
        Returns:
        a vector of hashmap represnting the results, each element represent a row, hashmap represnts col

      • run_command

        public boolean run_command(java.lang.String command)

        subroutine to take parameters of an update query and template it into MSSQL acceptable query, excepts update parameters to be with quotes if neccesery

        Parameters:
        command - the command to run (the query)
        Returns:
        if command succeeded or not

        public java.lang.String VectorToString(java.util.Vector<java.util.HashMap> vector)

        subroutine to handle result set converted vector to String, for testing purposes

        Parameters:
        vector - the vector that we want to stringify
        Returns:
        the stringfied form of that vector we got, or "Empty" if vector is empty

      • construct_add_str

        public java.lang.String construct_add_str(java.lang.String db,
                                          java.lang.String table,
                                          java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> vector,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map)

        subroutine to constuct an add statement for the MSSQL

        Parameters:
        db - the database we are working with
        table - the table name we are working with
        vector - what data we want to add
        map - what field types we have on that table that we add data to
        Returns:
        a string of the MSSQL command to add that specified data

      • construct_remove_str

        public java.lang.String construct_remove_str(java.lang.String db,
                                             java.lang.String table,
                                             java.lang.String where_clause,
                                             java.lang.String[] compare_to,
                                             java.lang.String type)

        subroutine to construct a remove statement for the MSSQL database

        Parameters:
        db - the database we are working with
        table - the table name we are working with
        where_clause - the whereclause to find what data to remove
        compare_to - what data to compare our data to
        type - what is the type of the data we compare
        Returns:
        a string of the MSSQL command to remove that specified data

      • construct_update_str

        public java.lang.String construct_update_str(java.lang.String db,
                                             java.lang.String table,
                                             java.lang.String where_clause,
                                             java.lang.String[] compare_to,
                                             java.lang.String type,
                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> update_to)

        subroutine to construct a update statement for the MSSQL database for mulitple where clauses

        Parameters:
        db - the database we are working with
        table - the table name we are working with
        where_clause - the whereclause to find what data to remove
        compare_to - what data to compare our data to
        type - what is the type of the data we compare
        update_to - what to update our data to
        Returns:
        a string of the MSSQL command to update that specified data

      • construct_update_str_multiwhere_text

        public java.lang.String construct_update_str_multiwhere_text(java.lang.String db,
                                                             java.lang.String table,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> where_clause,
                                                             java.lang.String all_type,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> update_to,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> complete_map)

        subroutine to construct a update statement for the MSSQL database for mulitple where clauses like previous, only multi-variables

        Parameters:
        db - the database we are working with
        table - the table name we are working with
        where_clause - the whereclause to find what data to remove
        update_to - what to update our data to
        all_type - whats the type of all our data that we compare
        Returns:
        a string of the MSSQL command to update that specified data

      • add_quotes

        public java.lang.String add_quotes(java.lang.String str)

        add quotes to a given string

        Parameters:
        str - a string that we want to add quotes to
        Returns:
        the input strings with quote to the leftmost and to the rightmost

      • nirmol_input

        public void nirmol_input(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> input,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> types)

        looks at entire hashmap and add quotes if needed

        Parameters:
        input - the input hashmap that we want to stringify the value if eeded
        types - the typemap, to know if we want to stringify results
